title: Interpreting R-Squared Value in Gas Mileage and Speed Comparison
question_text: The speed (in kilometers per hour) and mileage (in kilometers per liter) of 13 cars 13 cars was measured. The regression equation is as follows: Kilometers per liter = − 1.80 + 0.54 kilometers per hour Kilometers per liter = − 1.80 + 0.54 kilometers per hour Predictor Coef SE Coef T P Constant -1.8 8.357 -0.22 0.833 Kilometers per hour 0.5360 0.1192 4.5 0.001 S = 7.15740 S = 7.15740 R 2 = 64.8 % R 2 = 64.8 % R 2 (adj) = 61.5 % R 2 (adj) = 61.5 % What is a valid interpretation of R 2 R 2 in the context of the problem?

choices.text: About 65 % 65 % of the observations are within one standard deviation of the mean.
About 65 % 65 % of the observations will follow this linear model.
About 65 % 65 % of the data can be explained in this situation.
About 65 % 65 % of the variation in fuel economy (as measured by kilometers per liter) can be explained by the least squares regression line on speed (as measured by kilometers per hour).
About 65 % 65 % of the time, the true population slope will be caught within the given interval.
